Event.0: Hurricane Irma becomes the most powerful hurricane ever recorded in the Atlantic Basin region with winds of 185mph (280km/h)
Event.1: American writer and political activist Phyllis Schlafly, who was best known for her opposition to the women's movement and especially the Equal Rights Amendment, died at age 92.
Event.2:
Evidence provided for black hole theory
At a scientific conference in Washington, D.C., this day in 2001, scientists described an observation of energy flares that provided strong evidence of the theorized black hole at the centre of the Milky Way Galaxy.
Event.3: Mother Teresa—who was awarded the 1979 Nobel Peace Prize for her charitable work with the poor, especially in India—died in Calcutta (Kolkata).
Event.4: Musical "Will Rogers Follies" closes at Palace Theater NYC after 983 performances with 6 Tony Awards
Event.5: Lawyer Kathleen St. Johns divorces best-selling author Michael Crichton (37) after nearly 2 years of marriage
Event.6: Lynette (“Squeaky”) Fromme attempted to assassinate U.S. President Gerald R. Ford; Fromme, a follower of Charles Manson, was sentenced to life in prison but was released in 2009.
Event.7: 11 Israeli athletes taken hostage and later killed by Palestinian Black September group at the Munich Olympics
Event.8: Palestinian terrorists attacked the Olympic Village in Munich, West Germany, during the Summer Olympic Games, taking hostages and eventually killing 11 members of the Israeli team.
Event.9: Author Ken Follett (19) weds Mary Emma Ruth Elson
Event.10: Motorcycle daredevil Evel Knievel (20) weds Linda Joan Bork
Event.11: 1st color video recording on magnetic tape presented, Charlotte, North Carolina
Event.12: Jack Kerouac's On the Road, one of the first novels associated with the Beat movement, was published.
Event.13:
Freddie Mercury
British singer and songwriter
was born
Event.14:
Werner Herzog
German director
was born
Event.15:
Bob Newhart
American actor and comedian
was born
Event.16:
John Cage
American composer
was born
Event.17: The First Opium War begins in China
Event.18: Sam Houston was elected president of the Republic of Texas.
Event.19: Twelve of the thirteen American colonies adopt a trade embargo against Great Britain at the first Continental Congress at Carpenters' Hall in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Event.20: Caspar David Friedrich, a pioneering early 19th-century German Romantic painter, was born.
Event.21:
John Dalton
British scientist
was born
Event.22: Marie Leszczyńska of Poland was married to King Louis XV of France.
Event.23: French King Louis XV marries Polish princess Mary Lesczynski
Event.24: Great Fire of London ends, leaving 13,200 houses destroyed and 8 dead
